extendedIngredients.name: baby artichokes
extendedIngredients.original: 8 baby artichokes, trimmed but left whole

title: Shaved Baby Artichokes With Lemon, Arugula, And Parmigiano
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Shaved Baby Artichokes With Lemon, Arugula, And Parmigiano a try. For $2.15 per serving, this recipe covers 11% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe makes 8 servings with 176 calories, 13g of protein, and 10g of fat each. 21 person have made this recipe and would make it again. If you have kosher salt and pepper, lemon juice, lemon zest, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and primal diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 67%, this dish is solid. Try Pear And Gorgonzola Flatbread With Baby Arugulan And Shaved Parm, Baby Celery and Shitake Mushroom Salad with Lemon and Parmigiano-Reggiano, and Arugula Salad With Shaved Parmesan, Lemon & Olive Oil for similar recipes.
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk the lemon juice, oil, lemon zest, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper.Blot the baby artichokes dry with a dishtowel. With a mandoline or food processor fitted with a 2-mm slicing blade, very thinly slice the artichokes lengthwise. As you work, immediately return the artichoke slices to the lemon water. When all the artichokes are sliced, drain, blot dry, and transfer the slices to a large bowl and toss with enough of the dressing to lightly coat (whisk first to recombine). Let sit for about 5 minutes. Toss in the arugula and basil.Arrange the salad on a platter or individual serving plates and garnish with the shaved Parmigiano. Drizzle the remaining dressing over the salad and sprinkle with salt and pepper.                  nutrition information (per serving):        Calories                        (kcal):                      100, Fat                        (kcal):                      7, Fat Calories                        (g):                      60, Saturated Fat                        (g):                      2, Protein                        (g):                      5, Monounsaturated Fat                        (g):                      3, Carbohydrates                        (mg):                      6, Polyunsaturated Fat                        (mg):                      0.5, Sodium                        (g):                      160, Cholesterol                        (g):                      5, Fiber                        (g):                      3,                     Photo: Scott Phillips          Rate this Recipe and View Reviews

steps.step: In a small bowl, whisk the lemon juice, oil, lemon zest, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper.Blot the baby artichokes dry with a dishtowel. With a mandoline or food processor fitted with a 2-mm slicing blade, very thinly slice the artichokes lengthwise. As you work, immediately return the artichoke slices to the lemon water. When all the artichokes are sliced, drain, blot dry, and transfer the slices to a large bowl and toss with enough of the dressing to lightly coat (whisk first to recombine).
Let sit for about 5 minutes. Toss in the arugula and basil.Arrange the salad on a platter or individual serving plates and garnish with the shaved Parmigiano.
Drizzle the remaining dressing over the salad and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
